messageBody:
Brian wrote:

>I only have one test in the TestCase, and if it fails, I want to leave
>the database in the state it was in when the test failed so I can
>inspect what happened.
>

Hmm... that's a tough one. I don't know of a way to query the
TestResult in this fashion.

I'd try to build up fine-grained assertions in the test method itself
such that if one failed I'd know what happened. It usually turns out
that most things I can inspect manually I can also let JUnit check for
me. Not always, but I push hard in that direction first.

Let us know if there's something specific about the database that you'd
like to test but are having trouble doing so.

Mike
